required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dimensional Changes of Free Epithelial Graft at Teeth and Implant Sites
clinical_study.official_title: Dimensional Changes of Free Epithelial Graft at Teeth and Implant Sites: A Prospective Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Center of Implantology, Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, Badajoz, Spain

clinical_study.source: Center of Implantology, Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, Badajoz, Spain

brief_summary.textblock: For the management of peridontal and peri-implant conditions, free epithelial grafts have been proposed to provide a sufficient band of keratinized mucosa with the goal of enhancing confort during brushing and reducing the level of inflammation. Nevertheless, these are subjected to dimensional changes that may jeopardise the final outcome of providing sufficient keratinized mucosa to teeth and implants. Hence, this prospective study will aim at shedding light on the dimensional changes and the variables affecting these changes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Teeth and implants receiving free epithelial grafts harvested from the palate

secondary_outcome.description: Avascular area exposed to the graft (implant/tooth surface)
Thickness in mm of the graft
Thickness in mm of the recipient connective tissue

arm_group.description: Free epithelial graft at implant and teeth sites to increase the band of keratinized mucosa

intervention.description: 1mm thickness epithelial layer harvested from the palate (1st molar area) is grafted and stabilised at the dental or implant area deficient of keratinized mucosa

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients in need of keratinized mucosa to improve the periodontal and peri-implant condition
- With no uncontrolled disease
- Non-smokers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with uncontrolled diseases and conditions
- Smokers
- Patients with sufficient keratinized mucosa

facility.name: Centro de Implantologia Cirugia Oral y Maxilofacial

reference.citation: Monje A, Blasi G. Significance of keratinized mucosa/gingiva on peri-implant and adjacent periodontal conditions in erratic maintenance compliers. J Periodontol. 2019 May;90(5):445-453. doi: 10.1002/JPER.18-0471. Epub 2018 Dec 7.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Center of Implantology, Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, Badajoz, Spain
